text: Use 'list_projects' to see all your hunting grounds before diving in!
The 'To-Do List' is your personal scratch post for tasks. Keep it sharp and up-to-date!
Always verify your targets, like a cat ensuring it's pouncing on a mouse, not a dust bunny.
The 'log_action' command is purr-fect for manually noting important offline discoveries or thoughts.
Strong, unique passwords are like sturdy cat carriers: essential for keeping your digital treasures safe!
Regularly 'view_log' to keep an eye on all automated and manual cat-tivities in your current project.
Be wary of unsolicited attachments or links, they might be Trojan horses disguised as irresistible catnip.
Use descriptive names for your findings. A clear title is better than a confused meow later on.
Patch your systems! Leaving vulnerabilities open is like leaving the cat flap unlocked for digital burglars.
The 'Asset Tracker' helps you map out your digital territory and all its interesting inhabitants (services!).
Social engineering often preys on curiosity. Don't let your inner cat click on suspicious links without thinking!
Link your findings to assets, plugins, and to-dos to build a complete purr-icture of your security engagement.
Enable Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) wherever possible. It's like having an extra guard dog... or a very alert cat!
The 'query' command is your digital cat sense for sniffing out keywords and patterns in your collected data files.
Regular data backups are your extra lives. Don't be a one-life cat in the often perilous digital world!
The 'General Findings' tracker is your central clue collector. Every little whisker of information counts towards the bigger picture.
Clearly understand the scope of your engagement. Don't go chasing laser dots outside the designated play area.
Customize your workspace with 'set_theme <theme_name>' to make your PPP experience uniquely yours and more enjoyable!
Network segmentation is like giving each cat its own room with its own toys. It limits the spread if one gets into digital trouble.
Explore the 'Meow-tasploit' vision by thinking how your custom scripts and tools can be purr-fectly integrated into the framework.
Did you know the first webcam was invented at Cambridge University to monitor a coffee pot? Imagine if it was for a cat cam instead!
A group of cats is called a 'clowder' or a 'pounce'. A group of hackers using Meow-tasploit is called 'The Unblinking Stare of Justice'!
The 'combine_files' command can consolidate your notes and logs into one master purr-chment for easier review.
Incident response is like a cat always landing on its feet. Be prepared, be agile, and learn from every tumble!
The term 'computer bug' might have originated from an actual moth found in a relay. Cats are much better at finding those kinds of bugs!
Don't forget the 'lore' command (if implemented)! Knowing the story behind Meow-tasploit makes you part of the legend.
Least privilege principle: Give users (and cats) only the access they absolutely need. No keys to the entire catnip stash!
The 'Action Log' automatically tracks many operations, but 'log_action' is there for your own manual annotations and genius insights!
Keep your threat intelligence feeds fresh, like a daily bowl of premium tuna. Stale intel is no good!
Cats can make over 100 different sounds, dogs only about 10. Meow-tasploit aims for that level of expressive feedback!
